topics.body:
"@MoogSourceVermona":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536061d563687214f2670000#post_536061d563687214f2670000
Well obviously.  Most people have probably seen it by now, but the morals of the show are extremely pertinent to the usa since when you break it down the morals are, "the war on drugs isn't working", "pay teachers more" and "give americans better health care".

Health care in the usa is outright fucking terrible.  When I got hit by a truck you know what was the first thing they asked me when I go into the hospital, "What's your insurance provider?"  It wasn't, "Any broken bones?" or "Do you feel light headed like you're about to pass out?"  It was straight up asking me for insurance before they even made sure I wasn't internally bleeding out or anything.  The second they took me off the stretcher they asked that too.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5360657163687272cb6a0000#post_5360657163687272cb6a0000
Looks like someone got fucked by heartbleed.

If you're wondering what I mean by this is that it's a severe vulnerability that is sort of fixed, sort of not, but yeah the only real advice I have is to back your shit up on a external hard drive, format EVERYTHING, reinstall, run bleachbit and overwrite disk space(two times should be enough), scan your external hard drive for viruses and then put your files back on your computer.

If it's a virus then it's one of those severe ones that can hide out on your hard drive even though it counts as unused space.  That's the sort of shit that I can't fix and if I got something like that I would have to resort to nuking it from orbit.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5360671e63687221c4850000#post_5360671e63687221c4850000

Can it do without formatting?
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536067ab6368723725390000#post_536067ab6368723725390000
It's probably hiding on unused space on your hard drive.  Run bleachbit twice(the free disk space option overwrites unused hard drive space) and go through your installed programs looking for something fishy.  What I mean by that is in control panel in the list of installed programs if something says something like, "browser software you don't recognize" find out where it's installed and delete it.  If you don't know what it is then don't touch it.

If that doesn't work I don't know what to do, cause that means it's one of those actually severe viruses.  The only advice I have at that point is formatting, run bleachbit and then put your stuff back on.

If it's a virus I wouldn't worry too much about accidentally putting it on a external hard drive cause _normally_ they don't hide out in your picture or such, but I still would run a virus scan on your external hard drive just to be sure.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536068e86368726b9d030000#post_536068e86368726b9d030000

So i got bleach bit, do i just send it to scan everything for the night?
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53606928636872704c100000#post_53606928636872704c100000
Well run bleachbit first, check your installed programs for any program you don't recognized, if you don't know what it does leave it alone, delete it and that should be it.  If it has a name you can't make heads or tails of leave it alone, but if it says something along the lines of "braceosearchbar" and you've never installed that then yeah delete it.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53606af6636872573e300100#post_53606af6636872573e300100
[bq="twistedmetalero"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536068e86368726b9d030000#post_536068e86368726b9d030000

So i got bleach bit, do i just send it to scan everything for the night?[/bq]
That's your best bet, but make sure to turn off your options for your web browser; don't want to accidentally delete your bookmarks.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53606bcb63687233bf010000#post_53606bcb63687233bf010000

Do i instant clean it or preview?

Your the expert here
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53606c576368722c0ea10000#post_53606c576368722c0ea10000
Don't worry about preview.  Also do NOT interrupt it, leave your computer on.  If it says, "6 hours" and you can't leave it on over night then immediately close it before it gets too far then start it tomorrow; it's not that big of a problem if you stop it before it gets too far and you only stop it like 2 or 3 minutes in, but I wouldn't personally interrupt it halfway through cause it would need to restart from the beginning.

This _should_ wipe out where it's hiding on your unused space which will make it way easier to fix.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53606cfb6368727b6a9c0100#post_53606cfb6368727b6a9c0100

Dont think it tells me estimated time

Also, im running something called housecall, searches for virus and malware n stuff
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53606de76368724b3f830000#post_53606de76368724b3f830000
Try avg free version; sometimes individual virus scanners have particular viruses they can't catch.


Also bleachbit takes a little bit of time first running it to go to the part where it gives you a estimated time; give it about two minutes it should go into showing a timer and then you play the waiting game.  Do NOT freak out when it says, "wiping disk space" that doesn't mean it's deleting your hard drive, what it is doing is deleting your unused space and not your hard drive.

Basically when you delete something from your computer it doesn't delete it from your hard drive; what this does is delete already deleted files from your hard drive which is the area a virus could potentially be hanging out on.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
